intro: Holboellia latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed holboellia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
